hash.name: schedule
hash.description:
[deprecated; use sched instead] Contains the scheduler parameters, one per line.
The Hard CPU limit uses a mechanism called a Token Bucket. the concept is simple: you have a bucket of a certain size which is filled with a specified amount R of tokens each interval T until the maximum is reached (excess tokens are spilled). At each timer tick, a running process consumes one token from the bucket, unless the bucket is empty. If the bucket is empty the process is put in the hold queue. When the bucket has been refilled to at least M tokens, all on hold processes are rescheduled.
See the Linux VServer Wiki for more information about this file.

key.name: fill-rate
key.description: Amount of tokens append to the bucket each interval.

key.name: interval
key.description: The intervall between refills of amount fill_rate. This value is express in ticks.

key.name: tokens-min
key.description: The minimum amount of tokens required to unhold processes
